rule.heading: Rule 1: XML Documents Must Have a Root Element
rule.description: Every XML document must begin with a single root element that encloses all other elements.

rule.heading: Rule 2: The XML Prolog (Declaration)
rule.description: An optional but recommended declaration at the top of the document defines the XML version and character encoding.

rule.heading: Rule 3: All XML Elements Must Have a Closing Tag
rule.description: Unlike HTML, XML is strictâ€”every opening tag must have a corresponding closing tag. Self-closing tags are allowed for empty elements.
rule.example: code sample: < p > This is a paragraph. < /p > < br / >

rule.heading: Rule 4: XML Tags Must Be Properly Nested
rule.description: Elements must be nested correctly. You cannot close a parent before its children are closed.

rule.heading: Rule 5: XML Is Case-Sensitive
rule.description: Tag names are case-sensitive. <Item> and <item> are treated as completely different elements.

rule.heading: Rule 6: Attribute Values Must Be Quoted
rule.description: All attribute values must be enclosed in either single or double quotes.
rule.example: code sample: < b >< i > This text is bold and italic < /i >< /b >
